Shortly afterward, you changed the central code at the base, but you didn’t inform the others. They couldn’t access the system’s database. You hid the base from them.
dia_C9_M3_op2_2: Teo: I felt I couldn’t escape this. I could no longer change, that... this was the story of my life. Everything that was once alive has now solidified. Just as nothing alive can grow from this soil, neither can my life take a new direction.
dia_C9_M3_op2_3: Aiza: It wasn’t an accident, was it?
dia_C9_M3_op2_4: Teo: For so long, I felt nothing. Then one day, inspiration struck; I could actually finish my work. It was a lifetime’s work in the glass dome. I thought, if anything is of value from this, now it will be revealed.
lbl_C9_M3_op2_q1: ▶ Do you know what I found in the greenhouse two days ago?
dia_C9_M3_op3_1: Aiza: Then tell me, how did you end the research?
dia_C9_M3_op3_2: Teo: I remember very well how I ended the research. One evening, after spending eight hours in the lab, suddenly, as if after a long period of fruitless effort, I was struck by a genuine inspiration.
dia_C9_M3_op3_4: Teo: For the past two months, I had been working solely on cultivating the prime sample. A series of desperate experiments... you know how it is, a part of the researcher's life. Meanwhile, the time spent alone compelled me to converse with myself. Perhaps, along with the seeds, my faith in myself was also barren. The lack of results is not the fault of hope; this soil is dead. So, in essence, I completed my work. It was a lifetime’s labor within that greenhouse. I concluded that if any value lies in this, it will be revealed now. I finished a long conversation that might have been ongoing for ages.
lbl_C9_M3_op3_q1: ▶ I suspected it wasn’t an accident.
lbl_C9_M3_op3_q2: ▶ But the seeds did not perish. I have them with me.
dia_C9_M3_op4_1: Aiza: How many times are we going to start this over? I came for you, trying to drag you back to life, to find out what happened to you, and I keep running into walls.
dia_C9_M3_op4_2: Teo: It hardly matters anymore... when we return, I’ll make a report. I’ll tell them that all the seeds were destroyed in the accident. They are irreplaceable, even if some among them had promise...
dia_C9_M3_op4_3: Aiza: That’s not how it happened. I don’t know exactly how, but it didn’t happen that way. A batch of samples was protected in the greenhouse’s security safe. Not everything disappeared.
dia_C9_M3_op4_4: Teo: What happened to those seeds?
dia_C10_S1_positive_1: Aiza: I need to tell you something...
dia_C10_S1_positive_2: Teo: Honestly, I want you to know that if I could undo it... I... I wish I had never come here.
dia_C10_S1_positive_3: Aiza: I’ll pause here for a moment.
dia_C10_S2_positive_1: Aiza: Do you know what I found in the greenhouse two days ago?
dia_C10_S1_mid_1: Teo: There’s something I need to tell you. About the lab...
dia_C10_S1_mid_2: Aiza: I know it wasn’t an accident. I know you sabotaged the research.
dia_C10_S2_mid_1: Teo: That’s actually why you came, isn’t it? You wanted to take the materials.
dia_C10_S2_mid_2: Aiza: Why did you do it?
dia_C10_S2_mid_3: Teo: They shouldn’t get this. We don’t deserve another chance.
dia_C10_S3_mid_1: Teo: We cannot continue to reshape the world according to our needs, even though it’s an instinctive first thought. We must adapt ourselves to the world.
dia_C10_S4_mid_1: Teo: You need to know that I am not proud...
dia_C10_S4_mid_2: Aiza: But then you changed your mind.
dia_C10_S5_mid_2: Aiza: Grandpa, I’m sure you think I’ll be able to decipher all your thoughts. I’m also sure that over time, you'll feel better once we’re away from this desolate place where you’ve exiled yourself. But you need to know that there are places I cannot reach. I can carry you part of the way, but eventually, there will come a point where you’ll have to continue on your own and return to be with us again. There’s a place only you know the way to.
dia_C10_S1_negative_1: Teo: There’s something I need to tell you. About the lab...
dia_C10_S1_negative_2: Aiza: The samples didn’t perish. I brought them all. They’re here with me.
dia_C10_S2_negative_1: Teo: So, that’s why you came, isn’t it? You wanted to take the materials.
dia_C10_S2_negative_2: Aiza: Why did you keep it a secret?
dia_C10_S2_negative_3: Teo: They shouldn’t have this. We don’t deserve another chance.
dia_C10_S3_negative_1: Teo: We cannot continue to reshape the world according to our needs, even if it’s our instinctive first thought. We must adapt ourselves to the world.
dia_C10_S4_negative_1: Aiza: What are you talking about? This is our life, your family’s life. It affects you too.
dia_C10_S4_negative_2: Teo: Everyone makes their own sacrifices... I have no future left on Earth. I take responsibility for what I’ve done. I acted rightly.
dia_C10_S5_negative_1: Aiza: Thomas will be very disappointed...
dia_C10_S5_negative_2: Teo: I’m disappointed in all of you too. I’m disappointed.
dia_C11_S8: Teo: It must be left, for this is not a place where one ought to be or stay. It is unbearable due to its intolerable, cold, sorrowful, desolate, and deathly weight.
dia_C11_S9: Teo: Escape is necessary, grab the suitcase—above all, the suitcase. Two suitcases should be enough.
dia_C11_S10: Teo: Pack everything into them, then click the locks shut, and rush to the cobblers, marching and marching and marching again.
dia_C11_S11: Teo: For boots are required, a pair of good boots, definitely. A good pair of boots and two suitcases should suffice, as long as it is known (for that is the first step)
dia_C11_S12: Teo: Exactly where one is. Thus, a practical skill is required, a very practical knowledge, not some guiding emotion or a vague, hidden feeling from deep within the heart.
dia_C11_S13: Teo: A sense, as if it could be held in one’s hands, to determine the current location, from which the correct direction will then be selected.
dia_C11_S14: Teo: A special navigational device, so one can say, 'Here is the location in space,' incidentally at a particularly unbearable, intolerable, cold, sorrowful, desolate, and deathly intersection.
dia_C11_S15: Teo: From which departure is necessary, for it is not a place where one can know how to be and remain. At this swampy, disturbingly dark point in space, one is utterly incapable of anything other than declaring the need to leave, and to leave immediately, without thinking.
journal_1: Hétfőn bejelentette a tudományos világ egyik legelismertebb alakja, Dr. Bolyai Teo, hogy végérvényesen megszakítja a kapcsolatát a Marson folytatott kutatásokat irányító szervezettel. Dr. Bolyai, a Növénybiológiai Intézet professzora, eddig a Marsi Kutatási Projekt élén vezette a növények viselkedésével kapcsolatos kutatásokat, amelyekről azonban kevés konkrét információ szivárgott ki a nagyközönség felé.
journal_2: Az események kibontakozása során a titokzatosság még inkább érdekessé vált, amikor kiderült, hogy a kutatások eredményei teljes mértékben titkosítva vannak, és nem tudni, hogy a szervezet Marsi bázisa mikor osztja meg azokat a nyilvánossággal.
journal_3: A szóvivő, Dr. Emily Whigham, aki a Marson folytatott kutatásokkal kapcsolatos információkért felel, nem osztott meg részleteket az ügy kapcsán. "Ez egy kényes időszak a kutatásainkban, és tiszteletben tartjuk Bolyai professzor úr elhatározását. Reméljük, hogy ez csak átmeneti állapot, és a jövőben újra részt vesz a projektben" - mondta a szóvivő.
journal_4: Dr. Bolyai hosszú éveken keresztül aktívan felszólalt az éghajlatváltozás és a növények alkalmazkodó képességeinek kapcsolatáról. Munkássága nem csak a tudományos közösségben, hanem a nagyközönség körében is jelentős elismerést szerzett. Azok a kutatók, akik közvetlenül együtt dolgoztak Dr. Teoval, mélyen megdöbbentek és értetlenül állnak a professzor döntése előtt.
journal_5: Azonban vannak, akik Dr. Bolyai hosszú távú távollétét és a mostani történést is a kutatási projekt kudarcával magyarázzák. A név nélkül nyilatkozó kritikusok szerint a professzor talán nem érte el a várt eredményeket a Marsi kutatások során, és most a projekt hosszú távú sikertelensége miatt hozta meg ezt a drasztikus döntést.
journal_6: Az eset továbbra is sok kérdést vet fel, de a tudományos közösség, és a közvélemény egyaránt figyelemmel kíséri, vajon Dr. Bolyai Teo visszatér-e valaha a marsi kutatásokhoz, vagy véglegesen hátrahagyja azt. Egyelőre a titokzatos körülmények és a kutatások jövője függőben van a Marson.
note_1: Today, the development of the newly genetically modified plants was monitored. The resistance tests show positive results. The research is exciting, but working alone is difficult.
note_2: The variability of Martian weather affects the daily life of the plants. Along with dealing with changes in the atmosphere and soil, the daily regimen and strict protocol might be affecting the mood as much as they help. Is there any point in this?
note_3: One of the genetically modified plants unexpectedly developed a trait that increases photosynthesis efficiency on Mars. This discovery is a significant step forward in the adaptation of plants to the harsh conditions of the red planet.
note_4: Nothing has changed; soon all versions of the modified genome will be ready. Analysis can begin.
note_5: Analyzing the final results of the resistance tests. Excited about the results.
note_6: Five days have been spent checking the tests. Despite the photosynthesis efficiency, resistance fails at a certain point with all of them. Starting to give up on the whole thing.
note_7: Decided to let go of the high photosynthesis inclination, scaled it down a bit, and switched to other samples. At this moment, it seems a very promising mutation branch has been found from Cynara cardunculus. The system is being adjusted to this.
note_8: At the moment, it seems that a genetically modified plant variety capable of opening and closing its stomata according to Martian conditions has been created. This adaptation is a significant advancement! Although not wanting to jinx it, the data has been saved and will be sent after sorting.
note_9: The daily routine is starting to become monotonous. Nervously watching the behavior of the new mutant, but it’s not yet very noticeable.
note_10: Martian soil analyses are underway. The plant resistance is satisfactory, but still not feeling well. Yesterday, the thought crossed my mind whether the mission is worth it.
note_11: The connection with Earth is extremely thin. As isolation deepens, it’s hard to interpret the mission’s goals. The plants are gradually becoming the best companions. Feeling scared.
note_12: During climate modification experiments, the genetically modified plants surprisingly started to increase atmospheric oxygen levels. This discovery not only strengthens the research but could be crucial in the long term. Data saved.
note_13: The genetically modified plants are gradually establishing themselves as a colony. This is the most successful test group so far. Might be sentimental, but named it areophila.
note_14: As the year-end approaches, the idea of releasing the genetically modified plants has crossed my mind. Haven’t told Thomas yet; he would oppose it. Actually, he would be right. I should think it over.
note_15: Changed my mind. Releasing them would be madness. The year-end results are encouraging regarding adaptation to Martian conditions. However, mental exhaustion is visibly hindering the work. Maybe it should be stopped?
note_16: Things keep repeating. Just looked back to see how long been here. It’s shocking and awe-inspiring how much more can be endured while it’s so clear what is needed. People, real flesh-and-blood people. Family.
note_17: In the year-end tests, the new genetically modified plants are significantly more efficient at photosynthesis on Mars. Thanks to soil enhancement interventions, the plants can strengthen and grow faster, which is an important step.
note_18: After releasing the new varietiesmentett adatok, isolation would become increasingly difficult. This step is still under consideration. It’s just a thought right now...
note_19: The approach of the anniversary prompts deep reflection. The research still motivates, but now I have questioned the research’s purpose and importance several times. For a while, I’ve been thinking of this place more like home, and that’s a problem. Feeling confused.
note_20: The planned shipment will arrive before the end of the year. That’s good news! The genetically modified plants now form a self-sustaining colony. With this shipment, the reliance on the center will be reduced for a while. Made an important decision because of this.
note_21: The key question is what could be the most useful application of the research. Releasing them could cause an ecological disaster, regardless of the planet. This step needs to be reconsidered. Very worried about the weight of the research but feeling a bit better now. Grandchild wrote.
note_22: Fell ill. Probably due to a vitamin-deficient diet and the cold. The crucial information, however, is that the central system login code has changed. From now on: 2991.
note_23: Don’t know what to say about despair. Would be happiest if you were happy. Think of the birds when I want to calm myself. Birds live on Earth. Close my eyes and imagine being in the forest. The air is clear, no spacesuit, and I feel the warmth of the sun on my face. Listen to the birds’ songs, the rustling of the leaves. I’m young, old. I have no age. Maybe I’m already home.
note_24: These plants, however innocent they seem now, could be dangerous for both Mars and Earth. Don’t trust Thomas’s judgment. He lies to me; I see that he only cares about success, not what I’ve created. Left me first, now wants to reap the rewards. Need to go back. Need to leave here, but don’t want to take the seeds with me.
note_25: What is reality? Don’t know. When the bird looked at the computer monitor, thought it had no idea what it was seeing. And what does the bird test at such a time? Despair? No, it just does what it can. But how can it live so ignorantly? Actually, it has no choice. Anyway, the bird is perfectly fine even if it understands nothing about the world. Now you are that bird looking at the monitor and thinking to yourself: I need to figure this out! Maybe sometimes you have a few bird-like thoughts. Maybe you’re just doing what you can.
specification_title: Mars Experimental Farm System: Technical Description
specification_text: The Mars Experimental Farm System (MARS-AGX) is a complex, self-regulating agronomy platform, one of the most crucial systems supporting Martian colonization. The goal of MARS-AGX is to create new, genetically modified plant species capable of surviving and thriving in the extreme Martian environment.
technical_guide1_text: The core of MARS-AGX is a monitoring center controlled by artificial intelligence, which continuously observes plant growth and the internal environment of the greenhouse. The system is divided into different sections, each managing a specific plant species’ developmental phase: germination, growth, flowering, and fruiting. Each section maintains separate climatic zones regulated by the following parameters:
technical_guide1_bullet1: Light Intensity and Spectrum: Special LEDs with adjustable color temperatures and intensities, tailored to the different growth phases of the plants.
technical_guide1_bullet2: Temperature: Various temperature ranges for each module, continuously fine-tuned by AI based on plant responses.
technical_guide1_bullet3: CO2 and Oxygen Levels: Regulation of gases necessary for plant respiration and photosynthesis, which plays a critical role in growth cycles.
technical_guide1_bullet4: Soil Simulation: Hydroponic and aeroponic systems supplementing the barren Martian soil with necessary nutrients and water.
technical_guide2_text: One of the key functions of MARS-AGX is supporting the cultivation of new plant species. The intelligent system is capable of manipulating plant genomes and continuously adjusting growth parameters to create variants best adapted to Martian conditions. Plant phenotypes and genotypes are continuously analyzed, and genetic mutations that offer survival advantages are further developed for subsequent generations.
technical_guide3_text1: The greatest risk of the system is gas accumulation in the closed environment. As photosynthesis and respiration regulation continuously occur within MARS-AGX, the balance of CO2 and oxygen levels may be disrupted. If a malfunction causes improper gas distribution, accumulated oxygen in the greenhouses could become explosive. Additionally, chemicals used to produce nutrient solutions may also release gases, posing further risks.
technical_guide3_text2: To reduce explosion risk, the system includes integrated emergency protocols and automatic ventilation systems that intervene immediately if gas concentrations rise above critical levels. However, it is crucial for settlers to continuously monitor the system’s status, especially in remote and harsh Martian conditions where even a minor technical fault can have severe consequences.
